alert.note: Alert for Halifax (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Nash, central Edgecombe and southeastern Halifax Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Halifax to 8 miles northeast of Dortches to 7 miles west of Nashville. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Tarboro, Nashville, Halifax, Scotland Neck, Dortches, Red Oak, Enfield, Sharpsburg and Weldon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
